definition: hunting dog/hound/(fig.) running dog/lackey
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
see 兔死狗烹[tu4 si3 gou3 peng1]
pinyin: jiao3 tu4 si3 zou3 gou3 peng1

sentences.english: He described opposition forces as "traitors" and "sons of dogs".
sentences.chinese: 他称反对派力量是“背叛者”和“走狗”。

sentences.english: the mainstream civil-rights leaders whom Malcolm denounced as “stooges” and “lackeys.
sentences.chinese: 而马尔科姆则斥责他们为“走狗”和“狗腿子”。

sentences.english: These crowds shouted "running dogs" in Cantonese at those championing democracy.
sentences.chinese: 人们用广东话对那些带头的民主派们高喊“走狗”。

sentences.english: They attacked him as "a running dog for the government" and "the enemy of netizens".
sentences.chinese: 他们抨击他为“政府的走狗”“网民的公敌”。
你们这些异教徒的走狗。

sentences.english: The comprador -bourgeoisie is always a running dog of imperialism and a target of the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 买办资产阶级始终是帝国主义的走狗，革命的对象。

sentences.english: When the bosses send their lackeys out to cheat us?
sentences.chinese: 当资方派出走狗欺骗我们的时候？

sentences.english: An Egyptian slave driver entered our house.
sentences.chinese: 一个埃及走狗进入我们的房子问道。

sentences.english: Birds do, the good bow Tibetan, Jiaotu death, dogs cooking.
sentences.chinese: 飞鸟尽，良弓藏，狡兔死，走狗烹。

sentences.english: Afghanistan people cut up rough to sue to pull Dan and it the Tao of henchman Taliban day criminal acts.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗人民愤怒控诉拉丹及其走狗塔里班的滔天罪行。

sentences.english: Khamenei has called the MKO "America's servants."
sentences.chinese: 哈梅内伊将MKO称之为“美国的走狗”。

definition: dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
hawks and hounds/(fig.) running dogs/hired thugs
traitor/turncoat/rebel/renegade/insurgent
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
lackey/errand boy/lit. runner before a carriage
scum of a community/degenerate
pawn/lackey/accomplice (in crime)/collaborator/henchman/claws and teeth
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
accomplice/accessory
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
to rely on help from sb
to betray one's country
traitor
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
boss/gang leader
